titles.title: A bill to make the authority of States of Washington, Oregon, and California to manage Dungeness crab fishery permanent and for other purposes.
West Coast Dungeness Crab Management Act
West Coast Dungeness Crab Management Act
West Coast Dungeness Crab Management Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

calendar.text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Reported by Senator Thune without amendment. With written report No. 114-260.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 477.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)
West Coast Dungeness Crab Management Act
(Sec. 2)This bill makes permanent the authority of Washington, Oregon, and California to adopt and enforce state laws governing fishing and processing in the exclusive economic zone adjacent to their state in any Dungeness crab fishery for which there is no fishery management plan in effect under the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act.
